name: Goulash
description: A simple hearty goulash or as my family calls it, brown meat and gravy. BMG for short.
keywords: Goulash, Hungarian Cuisine, Beef Stew, Slow Cooker Recipe, Comfort Food, Family Meal, Brown Meat and Gravy, BMG, Chuck Steak, Onions, Paprika, Tomato, Thyme, Garlic, Curry Powder

recipeInstructions.name: Prep onions and beef
recipeInstructions.text: Fry the onions with all of the oil in the large pot. While the onions soften up quickly brown your beef in a large pan.

recipeInstructions.name: Slow cook
recipeInstructions.text: Once the beef is browned, add everything to the large pot and simmer very slowly on a low heat for about 6 hours. Remember to check back to ensure the mixture is not drying out and sticking to the pot. If required add more water.

recipeInstructions.name: Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.text: Once the beef starts to fall apart, season with salt to your liking and then it's ready to eat!

notes: We normally serve this with rice, peas, carrot or potato. Sometimes a mixture of them.

If adding carrot or potato, add them 30-40 minutes before youâ€™re ready to serve to allow them to cook through. If you like your potatoes mushy and full of flavour like I do add them about 1-1.5 hours before youâ€™re ready to serve.
If adding peas (my personal favourite way to have it) simply put them into the mixture and bring it back to a slow boil to cook the peas and then it is ready to serve!
Best to use smoked paprika. I like mine smoked and hot, I often add whole chillies to mine as well.
